column1: was on the fence to upgrade my gpu 5700xt but a decent gpu is way too expensive right now so decided to upgrade my ryzen 3600 cpu to the 5800x3d for better performance glad i did my frame rates and performance increased significantly now i can wait until a couple years to upgrade and maybe gpu prices to get to decent levels great purchase

great dropin replacement for my 3900x i primarily play wow lol and csgo cpubound games and it made an astonishing difference for wow in particular im getting twice the framerate i was getting previously in virtually all scenarios for gaming in particular this cpu is phenomenal
what can i say flawless processor the best on am4 for gaming make sure you use it with a good sink updated bioa mainboard and lots of fun
its amazing for games however value wise you can go with something cheaper from the 5000 series and still get great performance

honestly impressed with this cpu a friend said its the first cpu that made all stutters in games finally go away the vcache is what makes this so special 4k gaming vr gaming benefits greatly from this cpu as texture streaming in games is incredible its a must buy for pc gaming 4k120fps

love this cpu great for handling ai intensive games havent ran into any issues running multiple programs and gaming streaming running 64gb 3200 ram and a 2070 will update my review as i am only two months in and i am using a 2070 super gpu until i buy a new one looking at the 3070 ti
i literally brought this for escape from tarkov to run streets map lol i basically went from 60fps with my 5600x to 90100fps very happy with the upgrade would definitely recommend
dont know what its for haha but ordered for partner and hes happy with it so thank you

amazon deliverd on time and the cpu is a dream i use a duel fan cooler so i had to underclock to keep temps down but overall the performance hit was minimal 2 or less i went from a 3700x to this and fps in all games increased by 40 or more love this thing

awesome chip made a very long overdue upgrade from an i74790s to the 5800x3d and it is great i play a bit of star citizen and with this new cpu it doubled my framerate in star citizen without even changing the gpu its a damn good chip
fantastic upgrade from my r5 3600 getting almost 20fps extra in msfs cpu was bottlenecking before really good price was like £100 off rrp when i brought it recommend
extremely capable processor coming from a 4th gen intel i5 this is an amazing cpu brilliant for gaming if thats your main use for your pc

what can i say this is a great processor for all games that tend not to be limited gpus therefore simulators rts mmos esports titles played in 1080p at very high frames things like that on iracing i literally doubled the frames by upgrading from a 3600x if you only play aaa or in 4k its not necessarily worth spending that much

even with the likes of the amd 7000s and inter 13th gen the 5800x3d is still among the best gaming cpus if you already have an am4 system it could be an awesome drop in upgrade there are many game reviews of the 5800x3d check to see how it works with the specific games you play first as not every game benefits from the extra cache

very good processor in terms of performance excellent in all areas despite everything it heats up a lot i can reach 75 degrees in games with a 240mm nzxt watercooling system provided there is good cooling

needed to change cpu as i was upgrading my pc this is one of the best processors for gaming anything higher end than this is a bit overkill for gaming and the price wasnt too bad considering the price of other pc parts installing a new cpu can be a bit daunting just make sure you do the research before committing

paired with a simple rx 6800 sam enabled i was getting 80 in my spawn hab in nb and once the shaders loaded in i was averaging 110ish all the way to the asop 140160 in space with my old 5600x i was lucky to see 70 s so yeah i m happy this took place on the 318 ptu on feb 26th 2023 so your experience may vary
great processor for gaming system on board cache helps keep performance high easy to install
best processor for gaming huge improvement over the 3700x
went from 80 fps to 130 on escape from tarkov beautiful cpu make sure to pair it with some high speed ram and you wont regret it

bought last week box turned up empty amazon sorted a next day replacement which also turned up empty now waiting around to sign a form itself late in order to get a refund having since bought from elsewhere i can say that cpu turned up first time of asking imagine that itself is great good luck with the roulette
super proc le seul bémol la chauffe test avec watercooling a fond 45 mhz a 82 dg en jeu entre 60 et 71 dg reste stable pas de problèmes sur ce proc

it is very powerful compared to a ryzen 2700x in games with a 3070 it gets about 40 fps more and also when streaming it drops very few fps if you want to play stream and edit videos in 4k this is your processor if its just for editing or multicore tasks buy the normal 5800x and save yourself some money

it has been the best upgrade i could have provided for my old ryzen 7 1700 machine and by adding another two sticks of ram to populate all of the available ram slots the full potential of this cpu has been unlocked even on something as old as an asus crosshair vi hero

this thing is a beast it runs extremely hot even with a really good fan setup temperatures of 7080 are considered good for this chip at full throttle the extra cache is so good and this chip destroys my ryzen 7 3700x even at 30 cpu usage animal performance
i upgraded from a 1600x i knew there would be a vast improvement but wow this cpu is incredible
nothing to say except that it is the best at gaming i paired it with a 4080 oc and its a pleasure maybe a small complaint about the heating but with good cooling it passes
absolutely great performing cpu would highly recommend

i use my computer for simracing with triples my setup includes x590 motherboard ddr4 3600mhz 32gb ram and rtx 3080ti with the upgrade the fps performance was huge around 70 more fps but you need a very good cpu cooler because this cpu is running very hot around 80 85 celsius on gaming load but is 10000 recommended
went from a 3600 to this and the difference was night and day great uplift in performance in games and should last a good few years
great thanks
the best cpu for gaming in price to performance ratio highly recommend for upgrade if you are still on the am4 socket
love this cpu as i get a massive performance boost from my ryzen 7 2700x and i dont need a new motherboard
the very best am4 cpu for gaming the l3 cache is amazing the clock speed isnt the best but this cpu holds it own vs intels 55ghz chips
really impressed in the difference this has made to msfs 2020 i dont do other games no temp increase very impressed

i wanted to increase my fps for eft and with the new technology in the x3d paired with the 6800xt they are a perfect match im getting 130 fps on streets and every other game runs flawlessly on ultra settings must buy
bought to get something out for the base top performance price significantly too high due to the existing am5 platform but unrivalled for the socket upgrading is worthwhile i can recommend it

if you re looking to play escape from tarkov with this i highly recommend i use this with a 2070 super and now i get 100 frames on every map even while streaming on the same pc when not streaming i can easily hit 120 customs and on lighthouse it s gone as low as 92
if anyone is looking for the best amd processor for the am4 socket theyve found it here for people who play video games

i bought this as an upgrade from a 3800 xt its a brilliant gaming cpu and will keep my x570 mobo going for a few more years before making the move to am5 the 3d cache adds stability to frame rates and around a 25 boost to performance
lightening fast gaming cpu and runs on my old motherboard and ddr4 memory making it great value for money

went from a 5600x to this big performance jump l3 cache increase makes a difference in most of the aaa games im playing this linked with a high end 30 series or 40 series graphics car will be a strong system for some time
if you still have an am4 mainboard the cpu is definitely recommended i switched from a ryzen 5 3600 unbeatably good for gaming absolute purchase recommendation
great cpu i recommend a good cooler because it tends to heat up a bit what can i say for the rest its a bomb
processor ideal for gaming get a good sink because it heats so hot
from 3600x to 5800x3dbest move everthis is the best amd cpu they ever made dont be bothered with new 7000s series with this cpu youd max out on fps in every res you throw at it
great performance but i wish it was cheaper
what should you say this cpu gives the am4 socket another decent performance boost a stronger cpu is not required to play with the latest games on the market economical and powerful at the same time

bought this to use with my rtx 3080 1440p gaming machine the cpu is rock solid sporting a 30 all core undervolt with msi kombo strike temps nice and low as the cpu is water cooled this is the best gaming cpu you can get for the money 55
phenomenal processor top performance the best to buy for mobo am4
upgraded from 5600x everything is better some things are alot better
everything went well again and again with pleasure
very good processor stable and does not get hot

running this with my 2060 6gb oc until my 3060 12gb oc comes in friday and its runs games like a champ 160 fps in destiny 2 pvp 120 fps cod mw2 all high settings fortnite gets 200 fps with the ryzen 7 2700 wraith prism cooler until when my noctua comes in
this cpu act like a normal 8 core when you are not gaming when you do game its a nuclear submarine totally satisfied in every game ive tried
im extremely pleased with this cpu it gives the performance of 13th genryzen 7000 but its a drop in upgrade for anyone on am4 excellent stuff
this cpu is a beast for those with investment in am4 platform this is the end game for a pc gaming it uses about 100w during gaming and runs a little hot so make sure you have a good cpu cooler
processor insert type mount good cooling and enough possibly on the msi board with agesa 1208 turn on combo strike 3 most copies cope and it is cooler and in total more efficiently
this gift to the aging am4 platform will probably bite amd in the rear it s so good that it ll likely delay a lot of am5 upgrades i ve paired it with a 7900xtx and the results in vr are incredible

i technically downgraded in cores and threads from a 5900x but man oh man did i totally upgrade in smoothness during gaming my 1 and 01 lows saw a huge boost actually even just doing tasks in windows feels faster too
couldnt ask for a more powerful cpu totally worth the price
the game is cpu bound and i get over 143 fps with qhdi upgraded from 1800x triple the framerate of my old cpu same motherboard same gpu
even with the current 7950x3d out right now until the 7800x3d is released and reviewed this cpu is the best bang for your buck
currently one of the best for gaming in the game it does not exceed 70 degrees
massive upgrade even from a 5600x the 8 cores are great for multitasking and in gaming it absolutely destroys best paired with an msi mobo to activate kombo strike
for gaming this is fantastic major upgrade from 3700x now my 3080 is stretching its legs properly such an increase in average fps and lows
the performance in cpuintensive games is simply great
great gaming cpu
outstanding performance
i have x470 tuf motherboard 1080 non ti 32gb memory 3000hz upgraded from a 2700x and it is an amazing difference example csgo 2700x 200240fps 5800x3d 500fps
excellent gaming performance
arrived 1 day before the scheduled date excellent product
fantastic upgrade from amd 2007x

i have upgraded from a i7 8700k at 48 all core and some games have made very little difference but the ones that have its a massive difference vr is much smother and the main games i play have improved greatly just buy one if you have a am 4 motherboard

i have wanted this upgrade for a while but was to expensive now i have it its a game changer 100 running a samsung g9 49 screen its blown my mind with 32gb ram 6800xt i wont need to upgrade for a very very long time get one while there still available you wont be disappointed
used in a vr rig to upgrade a 5600x which was causing significant bottlenecks with a 4090 the upgrade was well worth it now getting more consistent cpu frametimes
one of the best cpu for the price cpu temps are a bit higher than my previous one but with a decent cooler it doesn t really matter
im very satisfied
for the price to performance this cpu is a guaranteed buy good alternative if the newer x3d versions are too expensive
amds gift to the gamers a product that literally puts the next gen of cpus into question
for the money you will not find a gaming cpu as good as this i moved from a ryzen 9 3900x to this ryzen 7 5800x 3d and my fps in games has risen dramatically using a msi 6800xt gaming z trio
good

the 5800x3d is a frame monster moving from the r7 2700 to this was a serious jump in gaming performance and i didnt have to buy a new motherboard all these years later i wanted to see what the 3d v cache thing is all about with the ryzen 9 being similarly priced all i gotta say is getting on the am4 platform years ago has been a very good decision
the marketing hype was all true for a change im using this in vr and its made a massive difference over the 5800x i was using before coupled with a 6900xt
ive bought many ryzen cpus and have been satisfied every time

this cpus performance in games is evenly trading blows with the latest topoftheline examples on the market this is seriously impressive for a cpu in a 2year old lineup on a 6 yearold platform any am4 user looking to upgrade should have the 5800x3d as their main consideration its a nobrainer

ive upgraded from a ryzen 2700x to the 5800x3d and its made a massive difference in games it is a bit more expensive than the standard 5800x but the diffidence that extra cache memory makes definitely makes it worth it i didnt get the free company of heroes 3 game with the cpu which was disappointing but it was cheaper than ebuyeroverclockers

does what it should do very well

was pivotal in a recent upgrade i went through my 3900x was bottlenecking my system hard i come to learn  i would probably say this cpu is worth 230 dollars but in the current state of the supply chain it s whatever

i was looking to upgrade my x470 2600x and decided this was the chip that would probably have the longest lifespan needed to flash the bios and bought a noctua fan to replace the wraith no issues at all with it so far
upgraded from a 3600 and omg it s night and day in games im saying nothing more other than it s a must buy
purchased this replace my previous processor when the main board went down stayed with am4 to keep costs down absolutely cracking processor

never thought this would add so much performance to my system but it really did did many upgrades to my system but this one fully removed any bottle neck to my gpu my rx6800xt now runs at 90 utilization with my 5600x i never ran over 70

the 3d cache in this monster runs circles around my 3080 i ve never seen my cpu usage above 70 so this leaves plenty of headroom for even up to a 4080

bought for an upgrade this is the last great cpu for the am4 socket and it did work with my motherboard after a quick bios update the box is mostly air from the factory there is no cooler inside else no too much complain except it runs a little bit more hot than my previous rizen
the pinnacle for the am4 board if gaming is your thing dont expect great improvements in desktop performance over 3000 series chips but if gaming is your thing this chip is the king for the am4 board
was so slow sad face

bought this is my pc was stuttering a bit with my 5600 this cpu cured that and lifted my fps right up wat a beast it is competing with the big boys latest cpus and still beating some in games if your on am4 platform buy one
gaming performance is above what i expected coming from a 3900x i have it paired with a 4090 and it puts in the work can t go wrong if your trying to avoid the bill to upgrade to ddr5 and am5

i recently upgraded my 5700xt gpu to a 6950xt and it didnt improve performance as much as i hoped the 6950xt wouldnt go over about 60 utilization so i thought ill try upgrading the 3700x cpu now with the 5800x3d gpu utilization is 99100 and i get as much as double or even triple the fps so i have no regrets
